flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
This is a beautiful Kusudama Ball. If you've never done origami before, don't be scared away. Take your time and you too can accomplish this.

I'm not 100% sure on the time frame. I have never started a project like this and worked it to the end. I usually take a few breaks....chocolate breaks! :)
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is a beautiful Kusudama Ball. If you've never done origami before, don't be scared away. Take your time and you too can accomplish this.

I'm not 100% sure on the time frame. I have never started a project like this and worked it to the end. I usually take a few breaks....chocolate breaks! :)

Relevant parts
  • Origami Paper
Tools
  • Bone folder

parts.notes: all the same color but different from the other 15

lines.text: You will need 30 pieces of paper: 15 of one color and 15 of another color
lines.text_raw: You will need 30 pieces of paper: 15 of one color and 15 of another color

lines.text: I'm going to use double sided paper for my ball. This means there is color on both sides of the paper. Usually one side has color/design and the other is white.
lines.text_raw: I'm going to use double sided paper for my ball. This means there is color on both sides of the paper. Usually one side has color/design and the other is white.

lines.text: I will do the directions in regular paper. Blue and Green.
lines.text_raw: I will do the directions in regular paper. Blue and Green.

lines.text: Cut all pieces in half.
lines.text_raw: Cut all pieces in half.

lines.text: You should now have 30 pieces of one color and 30 pieces of the other.
lines.text_raw: You should now have 30 pieces of one color and 30 pieces of the other.

lines.text: Start with one piece of paper. This will be the "flower petal." Make sure you crease the paper really well.
lines.text_raw: Start with one piece of paper. This will be the "flower petal." Make sure you crease the paper really well.

lines.text: Place paper colored side down.
lines.text_raw: Place paper colored side down.

lines.text: Fold in half, per picture #1.
lines.text_raw: Fold in half, per picture #1.

lines.text: Unfold, per picture #2.
lines.text_raw: Unfold, per picture #2.

lines.text: Take point at bottom right (A) and fold to center top (B). [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Take point at bottom right (A) and fold to center top (B). [Picture #1]

lines.text: Take point at top left (A) and fold to center bottom (B). [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Take point at top left (A) and fold to center bottom (B). [Picture #2]

lines.text: Your piece should look like a parallelogram. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Your piece should look like a parallelogram. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Now we are going to fold the larger triangle in half. Take the top right point (A) and fold to bottom center (B). [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Now we are going to fold the larger triangle in half. Take the top right point (A) and fold to bottom center (B). [Picture #1]

lines.text: Completed. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Completed. [Picture #2]

lines.text: This next part can be tricky, so take it slow.  Open up your last fold to 90 degrees. You will see there is a little pocket. [Picture #1 and #2]
lines.text_raw: This next part can be tricky, so take it slow.  Open up your last fold to 90 degrees. You will see there is a little pocket. [Picture #1 and #2]

lines.text: The top point needs to fold down to the center top, closing the pocket. It should make a square. Crease well. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: The top point needs to fold down to the center top, closing the pocket. It should make a square. Crease well. [Picture #2]

lines.text: I usually put my finger inside the pocket, pushing down on the paper. This makes the  paper open up. Then gently press down on the outside. You will see it forming a square. Make sure the top points are straight and crease.
lines.text_raw: I usually put my finger inside the pocket, pushing down on the paper. This makes the  paper open up. Then gently press down on the outside. You will see it forming a square. Make sure the top points are straight and crease.

lines.text: More pictures in next step.
lines.text_raw: More pictures in next step.

lines.text: Here are more pictures from that last step. It can be challenging. Just take your time.
lines.text_raw: Here are more pictures from that last step. It can be challenging. Just take your time.

lines.text: Take top layer and fold top point down to bottom of square. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Take top layer and fold top point down to bottom of square. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Unfold the fold you just made. Take the top right side of the paper. Fold diagonally with the edge along the center line. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Unfold the fold you just made. Take the top right side of the paper. Fold diagonally with the edge along the center line. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Fold down/over using the first fold. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Fold down/over using the first fold. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Now simply "close the book" taking the left point of the square back over to the right. [Picture #1 and #2]
lines.text_raw: Now simply "close the book" taking the left point of the square back over to the right. [Picture #1 and #2]

lines.text: Fold top point down to bottom, similar to previous step. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Fold top point down to bottom, similar to previous step. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Unfold.
lines.text_raw: Unfold.

lines.text: Take top left side and fold down along middle line, similar to what we did before. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Take top left side and fold down along middle line, similar to what we did before. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Fold down/over like before. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Fold down/over like before. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Take notice of the flap. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Take notice of the flap. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Fold so it's standing upright. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Fold so it's standing upright. [Picture #1]

lines.text: You are going to stick your finger in the pocket again to open the pocket and kinda squash the front down. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: You are going to stick your finger in the pocket again to open the pocket and kinda squash the front down. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Make sure it stays centered. You can see the fold line in the back paper. Make sure the point you just made is lined up with that. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Make sure it stays centered. You can see the fold line in the back paper. Make sure the point you just made is lined up with that. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Do the same on the other side.
lines.text_raw: Do the same on the other side.

lines.text: I turn mine over so I'm working in a similar way as before. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: I turn mine over so I'm working in a similar way as before. [Picture #1]

lines.text: When you are finished it should look like this. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: When you are finished it should look like this. [Picture #2]

lines.text: I made one more without all the black marks for you to see. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: I made one more without all the black marks for you to see. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Now the easy part! This next piece is kinda like a "jacket" for the first piece.
lines.text_raw: Now the easy part! This next piece is kinda like a "jacket" for the first piece.

lines.text: Take your other piece of paper. Lay it color side down.
lines.text_raw: Take your other piece of paper. Lay it color side down.

lines.text: Fold in half and unfold — same as before. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Fold in half and unfold — same as before. [Picture #1]

lines.text: This time we are going to fold the top right corner down to the bottom middle. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: This time we are going to fold the top right corner down to the bottom middle. [Picture #2]

lines.text: The other side — fold the bottom left corner to the top middle. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: The other side — fold the bottom left corner to the top middle. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Unfold both sides.
lines.text_raw: Unfold both sides.

lines.text: Let's put on the "jacket."
lines.text_raw: Let's put on the "jacket."

lines.text: Take your first piece and lay it in the center of this piece, kinda at an angle along the fold lines. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Take your first piece and lay it in the center of this piece, kinda at an angle along the fold lines. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Simply tuck in the flaps. [Picture #2 and #3]
lines.text_raw: Simply tuck in the flaps. [Picture #2 and #3]

lines.text: Place unit in front of you vertically. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Place unit in front of you vertically. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Fold the unit in half. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Fold the unit in half. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Fold the top left point down to the lower right side, making a triangle. Make sure to also fold the little tab. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Fold the top left point down to the lower right side, making a triangle. Make sure to also fold the little tab. [Picture #3]

lines.text: Turn over and do the same to the other side.
lines.text_raw: Turn over and do the same to the other side.

lines.text: Your first piece is finished!
lines.text_raw: Your first piece is finished!

lines.text: Now make 29 more!!
lines.text_raw: Now make 29 more!!

lines.text: Great Job - you've made 30 total units!
lines.text_raw: Great Job - you've made 30 total units!

lines.text: I made 3 in the green/blue color combo to show you how to assemble. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: I made 3 in the green/blue color combo to show you how to assemble. [Picture #1]

lines.text: I have also made 30 units in the black/red/pink combination (2 color paper) to finish the project. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: I have also made 30 units in the black/red/pink combination (2 color paper) to finish the project. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Let's Assemble!
lines.text_raw: Let's Assemble!

lines.text: Take two of your units. Look at picture #1 to show you the pocket and the tab.
lines.text_raw: Take two of your units. Look at picture #1 to show you the pocket and the tab.

lines.text: Take one of your units and place the tab into the pocket of the other one. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Take one of your units and place the tab into the pocket of the other one. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Slide the rest of the way in.
lines.text_raw: Slide the rest of the way in.

lines.text: We are going to finish the triangle shape by adding the third piece.
lines.text_raw: We are going to finish the triangle shape by adding the third piece.

lines.text: Lift up tab 1 and slide tab 2 into pocket 3. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: Lift up tab 1 and slide tab 2 into pocket 3. [Picture #1]

lines.text: Finish the triangle by sliding tab 1 into pocket 5. [Picture #2]
lines.text_raw: Finish the triangle by sliding tab 1 into pocket 5. [Picture #2]

lines.text: Completed triangle. [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Completed triangle. [Picture #3]

lines.text: I am now going to continue with the black/red/pink units. [Picture #1]
lines.text_raw: I am now going to continue with the black/red/pink units. [Picture #1]

lines.text: You will notice this unit has 3 colors. The red piece has pink on the other side instead of white. This can make for a beautiful ball.
lines.text_raw: You will notice this unit has 3 colors. The red piece has pink on the other side instead of white. This can make for a beautiful ball.

lines.text: Continue adding units and making triangles. [Picture #1 and #2]
lines.text_raw: Continue adding units and making triangles. [Picture #1 and #2]

lines.text: Notice the "petals." There should be 5 for each "flower." [Picture #3]
lines.text_raw: Notice the "petals." There should be 5 for each "flower." [Picture #3]

lines.text: Keep going... you're almost there. The ball will begin to form.
lines.text_raw: Keep going... you're almost there. The ball will begin to form.

lines.text: Here are some pictures while it's progressing.
lines.text_raw: Here are some pictures while it's progressing.

lines.text: The last few pieces can be tricky - just take your time. Remember: triangle and 5 petals.
lines.text_raw: The last few pieces can be tricky - just take your time. Remember: triangle and 5 petals.

lines.text: Completed!
lines.text_raw: Completed!

lines.text: Happy Folding!
lines.text_raw: Happy Folding!
